result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R Rauch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must sign up for probation within 48 hours. Probation can be reduced to one year if the Defendant successfully completes the conditions of probation.
Concurrent with: 16CF111

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on a Tuesday/Thursday, by 12/7/2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Joseph R Rauch in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS  16CF46 & 16CF111.
Plea Agreement. 
 Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 1 in 16CF46-  961.41(3g)(d)  misdemeanor. 
 Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 2 in 16CF111-  961.41(3g)(d)  misdemeanor.  Counts 1 & 3   Dismissed and Read In.   
The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.  
Argument by Defense. Defendant relates

Court orders: Sentence withheld  2 years probation. Must sign up within 48 hours. Probation can be reduced to 1 year if successully completes the terms of probation early. 

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Court costs. 
Possible Expunction if successfully completes probation.
